title: Regenerative Agriculture: A Solution to Climate Change

tasks.task: Understand the shift from industrial to regenerative agriculture
subtasks: Recognize the current statistic of 1% of the population engaged in farming in the US
Consider the potential increase to 10% or 50% of the population required for regenerative agriculture
Observe the necessity of labor-intensive processes in regenerative agriculture
Acknowledge the challenge of standardization in industrial agriculture
Comprehend the need for individualized land observation in regenerative practices
Reflect on the transition from industrial to regenerative thinking in agriculture

tasks.task: Discuss benefits and challenges of regenerative agriculture
subtasks: Learn about topsoil formation rates and the potential of regenerative practices
Grasp how regenerative agriculture can offset emissions and achieve drawdown
Recognize the trade-off between agricultural productivity and environmental benefits
Understand the potential for regenerative methods to be as productive as chemical-based agriculture

tasks.task: Examine the requirements for transitioning to regenerative agriculture
subtasks: Consider the increased labor needs for farming in a regenerative system
Acknowledge the shift from mechanized to more hands-on farming practices
Reflect on the importance of intimate observation and relationship with the land in regenerative agriculture
Understand the conflict between the standardization of industrial agriculture and the individuality required in regenerative practices
